ratings.rComments: Farhad is the man. By far the best professor in the political science department at Illinois. Teaches the stuff how it should be taught, not edited for textbooks. Yes, his class is hard, but you will come away from his class knowing the real side of a topic. Illinois will be at a loss if he leaves. Take his class for the material, not for the grade

Professor Malekafzali is far and wide my favorite professor at UIUC.  He is incredibly intelligent and will provide facts to back up his stance if you disagree.  His tests are hard but manageable, do the readings and attend every lecture.  I have never had a problem meeting with him to discuss papers, either, he is  pretty approachable.

Prof. Malekafzali is by far my favorite professor on campus.  I've taken two classes with him.  You can tell he is passionate about what he teaches.  Attendance is not mandatory but I highly suggest you go!  He doesn't put any of his lectures up.  Keep up with the readings! Take a class with him if you can, before he leaves!

The best professor I have had at this school. He may seem intimating at first, but he is very passionate about his lectures and is always helpful when you see him outside the classroom. Readings are  mandatory and even though attendance isn't I would not recommend missing any!! Go into his classes open-minded and you will have an amazing experience

Classes I took with professor Malekafzali (PS 300 and 304) were the most worthwhile classes that I've taken at U of I. I learned so much from his lectures, and I respect and admire his passion for the subject and professionalism he showed in every class. He made me feel that I am really learning about something that I should be learning in college.

Re Eval below: you seem bothered by how popular he is. So, you know better than the other twenty students in class and you know the topic better than both the prof and all the wide ranging readings. That's quite a stench for someone as limited as you obviously are.

Very knowledgeable and passionate in what he teaches. Provides great information and isn't afraid to defend his stances.  Tests are fairly easy: matching; multiple choice; and an essay. Only recommendation is that you do the reading because it's NEVER discussed in class on shows up on the exam in the form of an essay questions (guaranteed) a few mc

As far as professors go, he is INTENSE. But he is also very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Class attendance is not officially mandatory, but if you want to pass you need to go every class. He is very nice and very accommodating to his students. You will learn a lot in his class as long as you do the reading and pay attention

I'm a senior and I can unequivocally say that he is one of the best professors on campus. All PS majors owe it to themselves to take this class. While it can drag on a little bit (3 hours everyone Wednesday when I took it) you don't really feel it since the material is really interesting and evokes a lot of participation and debate.

I really enjoyed both classes I took with prof. Malekafzal. He is a fantastic teacher and I learned an enormous amount. When people ask if they should take his classes, I always warn them they are challenging but they will undoubtedly learn more than in any other class they could take. It has been a pleasure learning from Dr. Malekafzali.
Irrevocably changed my views of the Middle East. Enroll if you want to take away something OTHER than a letter grade.

I was afraid to take a class with him at first, he comes off pretty scary the first day but I ended up loving the class. Taking notes and going to lecture are pretty much necessary but his exams aren't bad. I think he's kind of funny
If you do the work, pay attention, take notes and show some respect it will pay off.  I learned a lot, and ended up liking him.

Please don't be so intimidated that you don't take this class, because I learned a lot.  He may be opinionated, but he's passionate and hilarious.  He has a very clear outline for his lectures that is easy to follow.  Just make sure you take notes on the readings to study!
Really smart guy, interesting material, but a bit dry.  Maybe it's because laptops aren't allowed.  Start early on the paper!

i consider a professor someone who takes the job seriously, enjoys teaching the material he or she loves with a passion and seeing his students succeed and share the passion as well. something this professor clearly does not have, he knows his stuff but that is about it

Farhad goes into a lot of detail and has an obvious passion for political science, but the downside of that is everything he says seems important. What he says is clear, but you it's not easy to figure out which things you should study for exams.

Some people understandably find it difficult to stomach the fact that he has a funny name. I did not find the class 'biased' at all. Even if it was, it is PS class so surely it would not have been the only one that was. It is funny how some are happy to overlook every other aspect of the class because the professor was perceived to be opinionated.

The reading assignments dont always correlate about what he lectures on, like he would assign a chapter in one of the three books to read, but he already covered the content two weeks ago in lecture. The exams are difficult, and theres no study guides. Arrive on time, or he'll yell at you infront of everyone! He has an intimidating presence

This class can be difficult. there is a lot of reading. Attendance not mandatory, but I highly advise you go. He does not use powerpoint, he just lectures. Grade is made up of 3 non-comprehensive tests and a 10 page paper, heavily based off of readings. Start the paper early. Professor makes little effort to meet out of class.

Professor Malekafzali is DA BOMB! I'm taking his class right now and I enjoy listening on what he has to say. I really didn't know what to think at first, since he came off as kind of a hardass, but he's actually really cool. 2 midterms, 1 10-page paper, and a final. Medium-High amount of reading. Doesn't matter what grade you get, take this class!
I liked professor malekafzali a lot. He is analytical and a very effective lecturer. His discussions are completely based on research done in Israel! I learned a lot and recommend him highly.

If you want to actually learn about the material in the class do your own research.  Otherwise he will just confirm liberal biases against Israelis.  Blatantly teaches his opinion on a very complex issue rather than evaluate the facts from a fair viewpoint.  Had various issues with his teaching and was not helped at all by the professor.

Thank you professor Malekafzali for a truly inspiring semester I spent in your class. You are a wonderful professor and your clarity of vision as well as depth of knowledge was awesome.   Your class taught me to evaluate evidence from both sides of the debate and then come to a reasoned conclusion.

This course is simply amazing! Malekafzali is sophisticated and erudite and his classes are actually fun to attend. Exams are pretty cool too. Overall, given the chance, I would love to take another of Malekfazli's class.

This is one of the only interesting teachers in Political science besides Mondak. The tests are straight from the lecture with one question from the reading. If you know all the lecture questions then you do not even need to read the books.  Just memorize all the points that he makes during lecture because the test questions are specific essay ?s

Are the previous two comments left by the same person! What are you talking about prof. Malekafzali not allowing audio devices. He has it on his syllabus: "Students are welcome to tape record. lectures" Sorry he hurt your feelings. Too much sense of entitlement, perhaps?!! He is a great professor.

RUN! Stay far away from any classes taught by this teacher. Very rude and makes no effort to work with the students if they have questions.  Don't expect to get a simple answer from him either.  Doesn?t allow recording devices either, I wonder why.

This professor was difficult, but not in a way that challenged me or made me work harder. His lectures are slow, made me fall asleep, no matter what I did. I find him to be a terrible professor because his lessons are one sided, basically him telling us what to think, not how to think or learn. Hard to get an A, not hard to get a B.

The Professor is extremely liberal, radical about it too. Often times he'll go off on irrelevant tangents about the poor state of the US. Intelligent though. One piece of advice, start the paper early. Tests are almost all from reading, lecture is pointless.
farhad's the man!!!

Exciting lecturer that isn't afraid to express his opinion in the classroom. I would imagine the class is very difficult if you aren't attending lecture or keeping up with the readings, but if you take good notes and like reading about public policy you should be fine.

Does not care about class.  Does not answer questions, or will answer with I can't tell you anything more.  No guidence.  If you see his classes, run.  This prof. has personal issues about the U.S. and takes it out in class.  If you have problems with anything, he is not helpful to discuss the matter with you. Better classes and teachers out there.

This is the third class I have taken with this professor and I am always amazed by how far he goes above and beyond in terms of teaching. His classes are not easy by any standard, and if you aren't willing to show up and pay attention then don't take his class. I have never learned more in a class, however, then I have in his.

I am only half way through class and it is apparent he does not care about student?s success in his class.  I have not got only one grade back and he has already suggested some drop his class.  I mean come on!  Absolutely no guides, as others have suggested and moves so fast you can?t keep up with note taking.  My personal opinion is for others to

Dr. Malekafzali is a great professor. He is one of few who demands that his students work hard. He cares about his student's learning,he is always available to discuss the course paper, very clear in his presentations.

Have you ever been in a class where you knew that you could get so much more out of it if only you had a different professor? Well, this is how I feel in Malekafzali's PS 220 class. He gives absolutely NO guidance and doesn't seem to care much as the success of his students. As long as he gets paid, that's all that matters. Would NOT recommend him!

Prof. Malekafzali is a tough professor. His lectures do NOT discuss the readings. He gives you absolutely NO guidence when it comes to exams. When I asked what I should study for the exam he said, "I have no insite for you, just know everything that I say." Don't take this class unless you know almost everything about public policy already!

While Malekafzali certainly has strong personal views, I don't think he can be faulted for it. He always prefaces things with "You don't have to agree with me." I think anyone who complains on here about his character probably had one or two of his remarks hit a bit too close to home.

I never give a second thought about the notion that "professors have a liberal bias" until this class. to me some classes are nothing but Republican bashing. I'm not a neocon Republican or anything, but he is basically forcing all of his ideas down your throat. Not to mention, it's very hard to take notes since he never slows down to explain.

I took Professor Malekafzali's 499 last Spring. I had also taken his PS220 earlier. He is a wonderful lecturer who actually cares about his students learning. True he doesn't care much for Bush and Cheny and not afraid to show why. If you are going to get emotional because of that, then you don't belong in college.
Very demeaning especially against republicans. Strict and mean, class totally sucked would never recommend anyone take a class with him.

Good class, I missed a few lectures and started the paper wayyy too late. Not bad if you follow Farhad's advice and start the paper early and keep up with readings.   He was really funny and intense and his stories were really hilarious.
He was a great professor and I really enjoyed his class. Just pay attention and take good notes and his class will be the best.
Tough class. Need to remember all of the texts. The research paper is collected on the final day. You should start your paper early or you'll screw your final.
Fascinating man.

He is HILARIOUS and intense, exactly the kind of thing you need to get up for an 8:30 class.  Reading is absolutely necessary and it's not an easy grade.  If you get up the courage to actually go see him, he is UNBELIEVABLY friendly and helpful during office hours! See him with your paper outline!

The class consists of a midterm, a final, and a 10 page research paper.  He lectures the entire time off an outline.  Very interesting professor, midterm was not too difficult if you did the reading and took good notes.  Can be very intimidating which makes students nervous to ask for help.

Teacher is very smart and lecture is very informative and interesting.  He is a tough grader, and you must study for exams to do okay.  It really helps to go to class too.  I studied and got a B-.  It's a good class but hard.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. He is useless and you don't take much from the class. He overloads you with so much information, you don't really retain anything. Lectures were a little interesting because he is a bit radical, so he can be used for a good laugh, even at 8:30 on a Monday.

The class is very interesting and you learn loads of information.  I never actually fell asleep in class, and that says alot at 8:30 in the morning.  But he grades way to fricken hard for a survey course.  I walked away from the first test thinking an A right?  Wrong C+.  Interesting teacher but doesn't understand student needs.
Outstanding knowledge and very helpful in office hours if you bother to go. He does expect rather than ask for a high level of effort, but as long as the final paper is good your fine.

Extremely unsympathetic. I became very ill for two weeks over finals and had to go to over his head to the department so I could take the final after the break - he then made me take it as a SPEAKING exam one on one! Despite being a straight A student I got a C. He also marks down if you disagree with his very left-wing views and I'm a liberal.

While the professor was quite entertaining, the course had many downfalls. He does not believe in studyguides, making studying for exams difficult. Secondarily, many exam questions were over readings that were never discussed in class. Notetaking is harder when his sentance structure needs work; doesn't know where "has" or "have" go in a sentance.
No Comments

He is excellent! Very intelligent. I've learned soo much from him. His lectures are really interesting and never boring.  He's absolutely hilarious too. He gets on rants and its just what you need at 8.30! Be open minded and you will learn soo much!  Read everything, attend all lectures, take good notes..he takes teaching and learning very seriousl

I agree that the prof. is a good lecturer and he keeps it pretty organized by giving outlines,  but I also agree that his grading came out of no where! Take notes on both the readings and the class lectures because his tests are VERY specific. Also, please start that stupid paper early. It is probably the hardest paper I have ever had to write.

Prof Malekafzali is a great prof- his lectures are always clear and organized, and he has a fine sense of humor. He helps his students understand themes and issues in political science, not just names and terminology. His midterm questions can be a little fickle, but anyone with a basic understanding of the US political system can manage and do wel

Professor malekafzali is not only intellegent, fair and in comand of his material but also tall, dark, handsome, always impecably dressed, and funny. Public policy is by definition boring. Professor Malekafzali, however, made this course into a unique learning experience. I looked forward to going to his class at 8:30 AM!

An incredibly intelligent guy. He knows his stuff like no other professor I've ever had and obviously puts in the effort beforehand to present it clearly and in a sensical manner. There is a good amount of reading involved, but by no means an overwhelming amount. If you want to really learn, take his classes.
An incredibley intelligent man. Can be crass and a bit biased at times. A wonderful lecturer. THE authority on modern Middle East politics here at the U of I.
He is a terrific lecturer, very engaging. However, his grading came out of nowhere and that could be good or bad depending on the amount of sucking up you do.

Malekafzali is a good guy, however his teaching style is biased. Expect US bashing.  He has admitted himself that he has trouble separating his Iranian views from his Doctoral view.  Yet, his biased slant might be good since it shows the other side which American media doesn't present.  Lastly, his map quizzes are harder than they should be.
He is really nice and interesting, in my opinion. His exams are not difficult if you go to class. Just make sure to do the readings!! PS 304 is probably the easiest 300 level poly sci, TAKE IT!
He knows what he's talking about when it comes to this class. You can't go to sleep, but you'll be glad you didn't. He has a lot of insight into the subject matter.

This class has an unnecessary amount of effort associated with it...the reading isn't too bad, but you HAVE to go to every lecture and take damn good notes...b/c you'll be screwed on the exams otherwise.  he's too picky when it comes to exams (he'll ask REALLY specific questions)  overall, if you can take the class w/ someone else...do it :(
Just don't take the class. You won't learn anything.  This professor is extremely eccentric, irritating, and he wouldn't last a day if he actually worked in government, outside of academia.
